messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Great Falls:
messages.msgSnippet: ... I remember walking all over the place when I was little.  I was out alone any time I wasn t in school.  I remember jumping in the backs of trucks with
messages.messageBody:
> AAaargh!! Are you (parents) studying martial arts,
> too?Such entities are outside of my understanding.
> Buddha said "Kill a mad dog."
>
> Poor little children.

I remember walking all over the place when I was little. I was out alone
any time I wasn't in school. I remember jumping in the backs of trucks
with people I didn't know if I'd walked out the old cemetery road to pick
apples, and they would drop me at my corner and I would wander on home.

I hold my breath when Dylan walks the four blocks to the library, and we
live in a small town where the biggest crime is maybe a bar fight, or
illegal fireworks.

Deb L

AAaargh!! Are you (parents) studying martial arts,
too?Such entities are outside of my understanding.
Buddha said "Kill a mad dog."

Poor little children.
>

>
> There was what appears to be a child abduction there
> Tuesday, a little
> boy, 11, riding home from some event on his bicycle,
> never arrived.
> Although Great Falls has recently been in the news
> because a suspected
> serial killer, whose victims were also children,
> this kind of news in
> Montana is uncommon.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Great Falls:
messages.msgSnippet: ... Thanks. My eye is OK. :-)  Just looked surreal with the pencil sticking out of my head. Sort of disorienting to the teacher. Sharon of the Swamp
messages.messageBody:
> Gee I'm sorry about your eye.

Thanks. My eye is OK. :-) Just looked surreal with
the pencil sticking out of my head. Sort of
disorienting to the teacher.

Sharon of the Swamp

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Great Falls:
messages.msgSnippet: ... There was what appears to be a child abduction there Tuesday, a little boy, 11, riding home from some event on his bicycle, never arrived. Although Great
messages.messageBody:
>What is happening in Great Falls?

There was what appears to be a child abduction there Tuesday, a little
boy, 11, riding home from some event on his bicycle, never arrived.
Although Great Falls has recently been in the news because a suspected
serial killer, whose victims were also children, this kind of news in
Montana is uncommon.

Gee I'm sorry about your eye.
Deb L, who used to fly too, but never in Great Falls.
